Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
CAN: The student may attempt to draw a simple element of a habitat, such as a single tree or a basic sketch of water (e.g., a wavy line for a river).
The student might include a familiar animal, like a fish or a bird, in their drawing, but without much detail or context.
CANNOT: The student is unlikely to correctly identify or differentiate between land and water habitats (e.g., placing all animals in the same generic scene).
The student may not accurately draw or label different types of plants or animals specific to each habitat (e.g., drawing a fish next to a tree implying it lives out of water).
There will likely be no clear representation of diversity patterns among plants and animals (e.g., drawing only one type of animal or plant).
The student might not organize the drawing to compare habitats, resulting in an unclear or jumbled depiction with misplaced elements
